titles: An elegy on the death of that learned, pious, and famous divine, Doctor John Ovven, who dyed the 24th. of August, 1683.
publisher: Printed for Richard Janeway, in Queens-Head Alley, in Pater-Noster-Row.,
notes: Verse: "HOw came't to pass that none did Silence ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
keywords: Owen, John, 1616-1683 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
